Revision.Description: Added Nexus 1010 and VSG as vulnerable products and included fixed software information for them. Added 4.2(1)SV1(4b) as a first fixed release for Nexus 1000v.

DocumentNotes.Note:
Cisco NX-OS Software is affected by a denial of service (DoS) vulnerability that could cause Cisco Nexus 1000v, 1010, 5000, and 7000 Series Switches, and the Cisco Virtual Security Gateway (VSG) for Nexus 1000V Series Switches, that are running affected versions of Cisco NX-OS Software to reload when the IP stack processes a malformed IP packet.
Cisco has released free software updates that address this vulnerability.

Vulnerability.Title: Cisco NX-OS Malformed IP Packet Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
Cisco NX-OS Software is affected by a denial of service vulnerability
that can cause Cisco Nexus 1000v Series Switches, Cisco Nexus 5000
Series Switches and Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches running affected versions of Cisco NX-OS Software to
reload when the IP stack processes a malformed IP packet.

Threat.Description: Successful exploitation of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory may result in a reload of an affected device. Repeated exploitation could result in a sustained DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: There are no workarounds for the vulnerability described in this document.
